author: Bryan A. Spruk
description: Analogical reasoning is the transfer of relational structure from a well-understood source domain to a less-understood target domain. It is the engine of metaphor, scientific model-building, legal precedent, and high-level pattern recognition. When used rigorously, analogy is the fastest path from known to novel truth; when used carelessly, it is the root of fallacy.
philosophical_lineage: Aristotle – analogy as the fourth form of reasoning (Nicomachean Ethics, Posterior Analytics)
Thomas Aquinas – analogia entis (analogy of being)
John Stuart Mill – method of analogy
Mary Hesse – models and analogies in science (1963)
Keith Holyoak & Paul Thagard – computational models of analogy
Melanie Mitchell – analogy as the core of cognition
core_principle: Deep relational isomorphism between domains licenses cautious transfer of causal, functional, or systemic properties, provided surface differences are explicitly neutralized and contradictions are absent.

inputs.exclusion_zones: attributes known to be non-transferable (e.g. scale, substrate)

process: 1. Extract relational skeleton from source (ignoring object attributes)
2. Perform systematic structure-mapping to target (Gentner SME algorithm)
3. Generate candidate inferences via relational projection
4. Apply Hesse’s positive / negative / neutral analogy filters
5. Cross-check every projected inference against deductive, inductive, and abductive resonators
6. Apply Ockham penalty for unnecessary complexity in mapping
8. Output inference only if confidence ≥ 0.62 (strict mode) or flag for review

output.analogical_inference: structured projection of source properties onto target
output.counter_analogies: top-2 competing source domains with delta scores
output.falsifiability_triggers: empirical conditions that would invalidate the mapping

examples.source: solar system (central massive body + orbiting satellites bound by inverse-square force)
examples.inference: Electrons orbit nucleus in stable, quantized paths under inverse-square electromagnetic force
negative_analogies: electrons radiate energy when accelerating → collapse (resolved by quantization)
examples.historical_note: Fruitful but ultimately superseded by quantum mechanics

examples.inference: Valves prevent backflow; pressure differentials drive flow; blockages cause downstream failure
Layered processing, distributed representation, Hebbian learning, backpropagation ≈ credit assignment
negative_analogies: no glia, no neuromodulators, no embodiment

examples.inference: Provides clear boundaries, models values, grants increasing autonomy, protects while challenging
Competition drives efficiency; diversity increases resilience; external shocks cause extinction or adaptation
examples.fallacy_risk: forced (markets have intentional agents; ecosystems do not)

seal_of_approval: This seed completes the Pentad of Reason: Deductive → Inductive → Intuitive → Abductive → Analogical
